byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Officials adopted stricter guidelines to determine when babies have been born with abnormally small heads, a step expected to reduce the number of false positives for microcephaly.

headline.main: Brazil Adjusts Guidelines for Diagnosing Defect Linked to Zika

snippet: Officials adopted stricter guidelines to determine when babies have been born with abnormally small heads, a step expected to reduce the number of false positives for microcephaly.
